title: Paul Kozlicek
text:
Paul Kozlicek (22 July 1937, in <a href="Vienna">Vienna</a>, Austria – 26 November 1999, in <a href="Sevilla">Sevilla</a>, Spain) was an <a href="Austrians">Austrian</a> <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> player.
His older brother <a href="Ernst%20Kozlicek">Ernst</a> was also an international footballer and was known as "Kozlicek I" while Paul was named "Kozlicek II".
Club career.
Kozlicek played for several clubs, including <a href="SC%20Wacker%20Wien">SC Wacker Wien</a> (1949–1959), <a href="Linzer%20ASK">Linzer ASK</a> (1959–1965) and <a href="SK%20Admira%20Wien">SK Admira Wien</a> (1965–1971).
International career.
He made his debut for <a href="Austria%20national%20football%20team">Austria</a> in March 1956 against <a href="France%20national%20football%20team">France</a> and was a participant at the <a href="1958%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1958 FIFA World Cup</a>. He earned 14 caps, scoring one goal.
